Data: 12.50pm Michael Clarke has won the toss and Australia will bat.
Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs Watson gets Australia off the mark with a boundary! A fine start as he reaches across to whip a lovely cover drive through the gap along the ground
Anderson to Watson, no run fullish and swinging away, and Watson punches back past the bowler
Anderson to Watson, no run a tighter line now from Anderson and Watson defends with bat and pad close together
Anderson to Watson, 2 runs another good cover drive, although this one has clunked a bit and hasn't been timed properly, it's chased down and they pick up two
Anderson to Watson, no run good ball, just straightening a touch without being prodigious outswing, and Watson defends
Anderson to Watson, no run defended again to the off side
Shahzad to Haddin, 1 leg bye swinging on to the pads now and Haddin gets a leg bye
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run again it's the wrong line as Shahzad swings it well down leg, Watson clips it away for a single
Shahzad to Haddin, no run better line now, outside off and Haddin leaves it alone
Shahzad to Haddin, no run swinging down leg once again, Haddin cops it on the body as he can't get bat on ball
Shahzad to Haddin, 1 wide oh dear, well down leg again and this one goes through to Prior and is called a wide
Shahzad to Haddin, 1 run inswing again but it's on the stumps now and Haddin softly whips a single through square leg
Shahzad to Watson, no run good ball, nipping in off a good length and Watson keeps it out
Anderson to Haddin, no run fullish and just outside off, Haddin drives but can't beat mid-off
Anderson to Haddin, no run good ball from Anderson, probing just outside off and swinging away a fraction, Haddin defends

Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs that's a cracking, punchy off-drive from Haddin. Really terrific timing as he just leans in to that shot and pushes it back past the bowler, Pietersen at mid-off dives across and can't save it, though he perhaps should have
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run driven away to the off side again
Anderson to Watson, 1 run angling in to the pads of Watson, who nudges a quick single through midwicket
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run down leg side again and Haddin gets a single
Shahzad to Haddin, no run left alone outside off, and that's carried high and quick through to Prior
Shahzad to Haddin, no run attacking the off stump now and Haddin defends
Shahzad to Haddin, no run Shahzad goes for the bouncer now, and Haddin ducks underneath it - after some consultation Rod Tucker and Asad Rauf decide that was legal, though it probably was too high
Shahzad to Haddin, no run good ball, nipping back quite sharply off the seam and sailing over off stump as it's left alone
Shahzad to Haddin, no run Haddin gets right in behind this one to defend
Shahzad to Haddin, 1 wide ah, Shahzad had bowled a much better line this over but he ruins it by straying way down leg again
Shahzad to Haddin, 1 run well outside off and Haddin guides it off the face of the bat down to third man
Anderson to Haddin, 1 wide down leg side, another wide, from Anderson this time
Anderson to Haddin, no run and another one swings on to the pads, this one strikes Haddin on the body
Anderson to Haddin, no run good bouncer - well directed and Haddin had to sway quickly out of the way to avoid taking that on the helmet
Anderson to Haddin, no run good bounce and carry again as Haddin leaves one outside off
Anderson to Haddin, no run ouch! This one has jagged back in at 143kph and whacks Haddin in the midriff
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run Haddin responds with a drive but not timed quite well enough to get past Pietersen at mid-off

Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs Watson hasn't had much of the strike the past couple of overs and he doesn't waste this delivery! Anderson dropped just a touch short and Watson lashed a pull forward of midwicket, super timing and that was always a boundary
Shahzad to Haddin, no run Shahzad goes for the yorker now but slightly off line, and Haddin keeps it out
Shahzad to Haddin, no run Haddin tries to work it through leg but there's a man at a sort of leg gully or short backward square leg, who cuts this off

Shahzad to Haddin, FOUR runs well played, though it was a bad ball, short and down leg, and Haddin just helps this on its way over the leg gully and there's nobody at fine leg who can save this boundary
Shahzad to Haddin, 1 run Shahzad's line is all over the place, now he goes a bit short and wide and Haddin cuts hard on the bounce to third man
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run angles on to the pads of Watson, who gently clips a single to midwicket
Shahzad to Haddin, no run fuller and wide of off, Haddin tries to drive but can't time it
Finn to Watson, no run fullish length to start with and Watson drives it back to the bowler
Finn to Watson, no run good line right on off stump and Watson punches to cover
Finn to Watson, no run Finn goes really full again, Watson crunches it back over the bowler's head on the bounce but it's collected safely by mid-off
Finn to Watson, 1 run this one is driven harder along the ground past the bowler but it's only a single as Pietersen at mid-off does well to dive across and save this
Finn to Haddin, no run good ball - Finn goes for the yorker with the angle in to Haddin and there's half an appeal for lbw but that was sliding down leg
Finn to Haddin, 1 wide strays down leg now and that one's a wide
Finn to Haddin, no run another good yorker from Finn and Haddin jams the bat down to keep it out
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run soft hands from Watson as he gets a single with a push towards gully
Shahzad to Haddin, no run Shahzad angles this in to Haddin, who defends

Shahzad to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin has got tired of waiting and backs off a touch to slash an upper cut over point, racing away to the boundary. The ball was short and wide enough to justify that shot, and he played it well

Shahzad to Haddin, FOUR runs and another boundary, though this one was a more genuine edge. But he went hard, and it flew over the vacant second slip area - he'd have to have been Joel Garner to have any hope, even if there was a man there - and it bounces away to th
Shahzad to Haddin, no run defended away to the leg side
Shahzad to Haddin, 1 wide another bad ball swinging down leg from Shahzad, and Prior can't quite take it cleanly
Shahzad to Haddin, no run solidly defended to off

Finn to Watson, no run there's an lbw shout as Finn angles it in to Watson, but Rod Tucker isn't interested. It looked to be sliding down leg but Strauss wants a review. Hmm, it's hit him in line but he's quite a way forward, and the replays confirm that is missing l
Finn to Watson, 1 run Finn tries for the yorker again but it's just a touch half-volleyish and Watson drives a single wide of mid-off
Finn to Haddin, no run this one's a very good yorker - Haddin can do nowt but keep it out
Finn to Haddin, no run oh, what a cracking off-drive but he's hit it so hard that mid-off, who is back on the edge of the circle, collects it so quickly they can't get a single
Finn to Haddin, FOUR runs ah, Finn gives Haddin just a little width outside off and Haddin backs off a touch to slash a cut over point, really well played
Finn to Haddin, no run fuller and angled in, hits Haddin on the pad as he can't get it away
Woakes to Watson, no run Watson pushes to off, can't find the gap

Woakes to Watson, OUT Woakes strikes! Watson goes for a hard cut behind point but he's picked out Collingwood, whose reflexes have not dulled at all! He takes a really good, sharp catch and Watson is on his way
Woakes to Marsh, no run Woakes comes around the wicket to Marsh, who defends
Woakes to Marsh, no run angling on to the pads of Marsh, who tries to whip through square leg but can't find a gap
Woakes to Marsh, no run fullish and angling in again, Marsh meets it with the full face of the bat
Woakes to Marsh, 2 runs Marsh gets off the mark with a flick off his hips behind square leg as Woakes strays a touch
Finn to Haddin, no run well now, this one has really fizzed through past the outside edge and thumps into Prior's gloves - good ball
Finn to Haddin, no run straighter line now and Haddin defends
Finn to Haddin, 1 leg bye Finn uses his angle and bounce to nip it in to Haddin from short of a length and it flies away off the thigh just wide of gully for a leg bye
Finn to Marsh, no run Marsh walks across and covers his off stump, and leaves it alone
Finn to Marsh, 1 run swinging on to the pads and Marsh turns a single to fine leg
Finn to Haddin, 1 run soft hands from Haddin, who nudges a single to the leg side
Woakes to Haddin, no run Haddin drops this one at his feet and thinks about a quick single, but Marsh sends him back
Woakes to Haddin, no run oh, Haddin is lucky to get away with this one as Woakes angles it back in and draws an inside edge that clips the back leg and sails just over the top of the stumps
Woakes to Haddin, 1 run this time Haddin gets a single as he pushes gently back past the bowler towards mid-on
Woakes to Marsh, 2 runs England persist with the angle in to Marsh, trying to deny him runs to the off side, and he flicks it through midwicket
Woakes to Marsh, no run pushes this one away defensively towards point
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run again Marsh clips a run behind square leg - plenty of gaps on the leg side for him
Finn to Marsh, 2 runs banged in a little short and outside off, Marsh uses the bounce on this to steer a cut safely over gully and it runs away to third man
Finn to Marsh, 1 run Finn squares Marsh up this time with a ball on off stump, it gets a thickish edge away through gully
Finn to Haddin, no run Finn gives Haddin some extra bounce now and he tries to back away for his old favourite slash, but this one just clunks down into the ground and bounces through to Prior
Finn to Haddin, 1 leg bye swinging on to the pads of Haddin, who gets a leg bye
Finn to Marsh, no run left alone outside off
Finn to Marsh, 1 run fullish on off stump, Marsh clips a single towards mid-on
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run banged in at the hips of Marsh, who helps this on its way to fine leg
Woakes to Haddin, no run Woakes comes wide of the crease and angles it in to Haddin, who shapes to back away and then defends

Woakes to Haddin, FOUR runs cracker! Haddin gets tired of this and gives himself some room and then powers this back over the bowler's head, and that is timed so well as it races away to the boundary straight back down the ground
Woakes to Haddin, 1 run more room for Haddin, who steers this one to third man
Woakes to Marsh, no run Marsh leans forward with bat and pad close together and defends
Woakes to Marsh, no run good ball, the yorker coming in from around the wicket keeps Marsh back and all he can do is defend
Finn to Haddin, no run once more Haddin backs away to the leg side and tries to force it through off, but this one doesn't find the gap

Finn to Haddin, FOUR runs fullish ball and Haddin tries to muscle this drive over mid-off, Pietersen is back on the circle and it's just gone safely wide of him in the air - it still wasn't timed that well but Pietersen's chase can't cut it off - he was going to div
Finn to Haddin, no run pushed away to the off side

Finn to Haddin, OUT well, Brad Haddin's walking around in the crease has cost him now, and he's been bowled through his legs! Finn gets his first ODI wicket as Haddin tries to move across to the off side and clip through leg, but he's missed it completely and the ba
Finn to Clarke, 1 wide bouncer to begin with, and Prior does very well to leap up and prevent this running away for five wides - it'll just be the one wide
Finn to Clarke, no run Clarke takes a big stride across to shoulder arms outside off
Finn to Clarke, no run another one left alone by Clarke
Anderson to Marsh, 1 wide swings this one too far down leg and that's a wide
Anderson to Marsh, no run swinging in again to Marsh, who gets it off the pad and this ball runs to Prior, not missing the leg stump by a great margin
Anderson to Marsh, no run full and swinging in, Marsh drives back to the bowler
Anderson to Marsh, no run another fullish ball just outside off, Marsh tries to drive through cover but Bell collects it
Anderson to Marsh, 2 runs good, hard running as Marsh picks up two with another clip through midwicket
Anderson to Marsh, 1 run banged in a touch shorter on the hips, Marsh just guides this one to fine leg for another single
Anderson to Clarke, 3 runs Clarke gets off the mark with a solid punch through the gap at cover and he's quick enough between the wickets to turn that into three runs
Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs another crisp shot, Clarke leans forward and across to flick a full ball with terrific timing between mid-on and midwicket
Finn to Clarke, no run better line on off stump, Clarke strides forward and defends with a straight bat
Finn to Clarke, 1 run Yes! yells Clarke after nudging a length delivery off his pads on the leg side
Finn to Marsh, no run good length delivery outside off, Marsh lets it go through to Prior
Finn to Marsh, no run Finn angles a full ball into the left-hander's off and middle stump from round the wicket, Marsh digs it out
Finn to Marsh, no run wider outside off stump this time, Marsh strides forward and shoulders arms with a flourish
Anderson to Clarke, no run short of a length just outside off, Clarke moves towards the ball and punches to cover point, his timing is good today
Anderson to Clarke, no run played off the front foot towards cover again, the length was fuller around off from Anderson
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run a touch straight and Clarke works the ball wide of mid-on for a single
Anderson to Marsh, no run good length angling across Marsh from over the wicket, played from the crease towards point
Anderson to Marsh, no run pushed off the front foot towards mid off
Anderson to Marsh, 1 run Anderson pitches short of a length outside leg, Marsh waits and pulls it off his hips towards fine leg
Finn to Marsh, no run full ball angling into Marsh from round the wicket. No room to work with and he defends with bat and pad close together
Finn to Marsh, 1 run Marsh tries to work the ball on the leg but gets an inside edge on to the pad towards the off side, Clarke calls him through for a quick single
Finn to Clarke, no run defended on the front foot towards the off side

Finn to Clarke, no run Finn angles the ball at Clarke's body from over the wicket, Clarke fends towards the leg side, Finn has a forward short leg in place and Clarke got hit on the glove while fending
Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs slapped, Clarke backs away to make room and goes hard at a short ball, flaying it through cover with power and timing
Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs straight this time, Clarke punches down the ground off the front foot, between the stumps and the non-striker and his timing is outstanding

PD Collingwood to Marsh, OUT And he's struck right away! He angled a gentle delivery into Marsh at 117 kph, it pitched on a good length and Marsh came forward to flick. He hit it cleanly but in the air towards midwicket where Strauss dived forward and to hi left to
PD Collingwood to White, no run Collingwood goes over the wicket to the right-handers and bowls a wider delivery outside off, White lets it go
PD Collingwood to White, no run fuller ball and straighter line, White clips towards midwicket
PD Collingwood to White, no run defended on the front foot towards the leg side
PD Collingwood to White, no run straight and simple bowling from Collingwood. White gets behind the line and defends towards the off
PD Collingwood to White, no run no width or length to work with and White has to defend once again towards the off side
Woakes to Clarke, 1 run and he begins with one on Clarke's pads and watches the batsman flick towards fine leg
Woakes to White, no run Woakes tests White with the short ball, White shapes up to pull but then bails out of the shot
Woakes to White, FOUR runs was that edged or steered? A bit of both perhaps but he placed it fine past the wicketkeeper to the third-man boundary
Woakes to White, no run White goes hard at a wide ball outside off but mis-times the cut towards point
Woakes to White, 1 run good length, angling into the right-hander, White pushes towards the leg side and runs
Woakes to Clarke, no run Clarke strides forward to defend a good length ball around off stump with confidence

PD Collingwood to White, SIX runs up and over! White gets under a length delivery and hoists it straight back over Collingwood's head for six. The field was in but he cleared the boundary by a few yards
PD Collingwood to White, FOUR runs driven fluently off the front foot wide of the fielder at mid-off for a boundary
PD Collingwood to White, no run defended on the off side on the front foot
PD Collingwood to White, no run defended confidently once again on the front foot
PD Collingwood to White, 1 run Collingwood bowls a tight line on off and middle but Whites pushes the ball past him and calls for the quick single
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run Clarke moves forward and flicks the ball off middle stump towards midwicket
Woakes to White, no run defended on the front foot towards cover

Woakes to White, OUT he's gone! And that is some delivery. Woakes pitched on a good length after angling the ball into the right-hander and got it to straighten off the pitch. White was squared up in his crease and his attempt at defending resulted in a sizeable edg
Woakes to Hussey, no run good length angling into Hussey. He defends on the off side
Woakes to Hussey, 2 runs too full and too straight, flicked off the pads through midwicket
Woakes to Hussey, no run short ball and Clarke ducks under it
Woakes to Hussey, no run pushed off the front foot towards point
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run driven off the front foot towards cover
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run Collingwood bowls a tight line on off stump, pushed towards cover
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run Clarke moves forward and across, pushes the ball firmly to mid-on and continues running
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run good length and extremely straight. Hussey plays the ball back towards Collingwood
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run 120 kph, Hussey drives towards cover on the front foot
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run Hussey drives the ball firmly but back to the bowler
Woakes to Clarke, no run full ball on middle stump, Clarke moves forward and across and plays to mid-on
Woakes to Clarke, no run good length and straight, defended on the front foot towards the off side
Woakes to Clarke, 3 runs short and wide and Clarke cuts the ball hard in front of point, Trott fields on the boundary and the batsman run the third on the throw
Woakes to Hussey, 2 runs Hussey strides forward and drives fluently through extra cover for two more
Woakes to Hussey, no run full and straight, driven back to the bowler on the front foot
Woakes to Hussey, no run played back to the bowler once again to end the over
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run driven off the front foot through cover for a single
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run Collignwood pitches on middle and Hussey uses the angle and flicks through square
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run Clarke closes the face of the bat and plays towards midwicket
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run Clarke moves across and defends from his crease with bat and pad close together
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run full ball on off and middle, Clarke moves forward and drives towards mid on
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run full ball wide outside off, 103 kph, Clarke mis-times the cover drive but hits it wide of the man at short cover
Woakes to Clarke, no run good length delivery outside off, Clarke lets it go
Woakes to Clarke, no run defended back to the bowler.
Woakes to Clarke, no run
Woakes to Clarke, 1 run pushed off the front foot towards mid-on
Woakes to Hussey, 2 runs full ball angling into middle and leg, Hussey flicks the ball through midwicket for two more
Woakes to Hussey, no run Hussey tries to defend but gets an inside edge on to the pad
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run Clarke strides forward and defends on the off side. Collingwood is bowling so simply, wicket to wicket at 120 kph or so and the batsman can't do much
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run defended once again towards the bowler
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run Clarke comes forward to drive and makes good contact, Collingwood reaches out with his right hand and fields on his follow through
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run tight stuff continues, Clarke defends with bat and pad close together
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run flicked off the pads through midwicket for a single
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run Hussey drives off the front foot towards Collingwood's left and the bowlers fields. Just one run off that over.
Shahzad to Clarke, no run good length delivery angling into the right-hander, Clarke defends
Shahzad to Clarke, no run Clarke defends from his crease towards the bowler
Shahzad to Clarke, no run Clarke tries to run the single to mid-on but there's no run there
Shahzad to Clarke, no run driven off the front foot towards cover. Clarke has stagnated after a fluent start to his innings
Shahzad to Clarke, no run Clarke strides forward and defends a good length ball towards the off. The Gabba crowd is stirring up some noise
Shahzad to Clarke, no run defended from the crease towards cover. A maiden to follow a one-run over. Pressure mounting.
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run full ball outside off, Hussey uses the width to drive through cover point
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run Clarke pushes the ball off the front foot towards mid-on and sets off as soon as he makes contact
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run Hussey works the ball from its middle-stump line towards cover
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run full and straight, driven past the bowler and mid-on runs and slides to his left to keep the batsmen to one
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run Clarke uses the width outside off to dab the ball towards third man
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run Hussey this time, opens the face late to dab the ball from off stump towards third man where Shahzad does the fielding
Shahzad to Hussey, no run left alone outside off stump
Shahzad to Hussey, FOUR runs short, wide, smashed. Hussey reaches out for a wide one and lashes the ball through point with a fierce cut
Shahzad to Hussey, no run this wasn't that short, it wasn't that wide and it bounced a touch more to beat Hussey's cut
Shahzad to Hussey, 1 run Hussey attempts to drive straight but the ball takes the outside edge and goes towards third man
Shahzad to Clarke, 1 run Clarke moves forward, pushes towards cover and calls immediately
Shahzad to Hussey, 1 run Hussey gets another outside edge towards third man for a single
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run full ball on off stump, Hussey times the drive well but places it to the fielder at cover
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run full ball on middle, worked off the pads through the leg side
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run Clarke tales two steps forward and plays the ball towards midwicket
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run flicked off the pads through midwicket for a single
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run Hussey defends from his crease towards point
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run Hussey moves forward to flick and plays it straight to midwicket
Trott to Clarke, 1 run the first ball is a touch wide outside off and Clarke steers the ball towards third man, 116.8 kph
Trott to Hussey, FOUR runs driven and driven superbly wide of the fielder at mid-off, excellent timing
Trott to Hussey, no run played on the leg side off the front foot
Trott to Hussey, 1 run pushed from the crease down the ground for a single, 115kph that was
Trott to Clarke, 1 run played down the ground towards long on again
Trott to Hussey, 1 run the slower ball at 104.9kph, Hussey waits for it and pushes the ball through cover for a single
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run driven off the front foot through cover again
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run good length and very straight. Clarke moves forward and across to play the ball towards mid-on
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run pushed off the front foot towards midwicket
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 2 runs a touch too full and straight, Clarke flicks through midwicket
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run played from the crease towards midwicket
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run full on middle again, Clarke leans across and flicks the ball through midwicket
Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs cracking drive through extra cover from Clarke as the changed ball offers a bit of pace off the bat, and Steven Finn, who has returned, goes a touch too full
Finn to Clarke, no run defended back down the pitch
Finn to Clarke, 1 run angling on to the pads now and it's whipped through square leg
Finn to Hussey, 2 runs and Hussey goes for a good cover drive now as he gets some width outside off, but Pietersen at deep cover keeps this to two
Finn to Hussey, no run driven back past the bowler towards mid-off
Finn to Hussey, no run angles this one in to the off stump and Hussey guides it to gully
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run beaten outside off as Clarke tries to force Collingwood through point, Prior whips the bails off but Clarke didn't lift his foot
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run swings on to the pads now and Clarke glances a single to fine leg
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run Hussey drives straight back to Collingwood
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 2 runs another pretty straight ball and Hussey tickles it fine enough to pick up a couple of runs
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run driven down towards long-on and it's another single
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run another one right on off stump and Clarke works it to mid-on
Finn to Hussey, no run short of a length from Finn and Hussey nudges to point
Finn to Hussey, no run Hussey ducks a bouncer now
Finn to Hussey, 1 run angling on to the hips of Hussey, who turns a single past square leg
Finn to Clarke, 1 run another one is on the hips, another one is flicked through square leg to the man in the deep
Finn to Hussey, 1 wide ah, Finn gets this bouncer wrong as it sails down leg side and is called a wide
Finn to Hussey, 1 run good, quick single as Hussey gets on the back foot and nudges to cover

Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs Clarke uses his feet now and gives himself room to pull a slightly short ball through midwicket, well placed by Clarke as he finds the gap at midwicket and picks up a valuable boundary
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run Hussey pushes another single through cover, keeps the score ticking along
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run Clarke flicks a single through midwicket now
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run a touch short and wide outside off and Hussey cuts hard in the air, it bounces down to third man
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run tickled away behind square leg and they can't turn this into two runs as KP fields
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run good, consistent line on off stump and Hussey punches through cover
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run Collingwood finishes with a slower ball, yorker length outside off and Clarke can't get a run back past the bowler

Woakes to Hussey, OUT and Woakes' fine day continues! Hussey has dragged it on, trying to cut hard outside off and the ball cannons in to the off stump. The ball was there to be hit, he just didn't get it off the middle, and perhaps a touch of seam in to the batsman
Woakes to Smith, 1 run Smith is off the mark straight away, with a defensive push to cover that he turns into a quick single
Woakes to Clarke, no run pushed away to the off side
Woakes to Clarke, no run left alone outside off, good line from Woakes
Woakes to Clarke, no run fullish and angling in, Clarke gets forward and nudges to off
Woakes to Clarke, 1 run Clarke drives through cover now and gets a single that takes him to 49 and allows him to retain the strike
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run short and wide of off to start with and that brings Clarke his half-century, as he cuts a single forward of point
Anderson to Smith, 1 run Smith pushes a single wide of cover, in much the same way as he got off the mark
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run Clarke cuts but can only get a single to deep point
Anderson to Smith, 1 wide bad ball, way down leg side and that's a bonus run for the Aussies
Anderson to Smith, no run on the pads and Smith tries to clip through midwicket, can't find the gap
Anderson to Smith, no run angling in to off stump, Smith just pushes to mid-off
Anderson to Smith, 1 run Smith opens the face now and runs a single down to third man
Shahzad to Smith, 1 run Smith drives through cover but can only get a single
Shahzad to Johnson, 1 run goes for the yorker and Johnson drives a single towards mid-off
Shahzad to Smith, 1 bye a good slower ball from Shahzad and Smith wound up for a big slog over cover, but the change of pace was too good for the batsman to connect, although they do snaffle a bye
Shahzad to Johnson, FOUR runs bouncer, Johnson goes for the pull and gets a top edge that sails just a few inches over the leaping Prior and runs away for a boundary
Shahzad to Johnson, FOUR runs and Johnson launches a powerful drive back past the bowler and gets another valuable boundary
Shahzad to Johnson, 1 wide oh dear, Shahzad is absolutely hobbling in here, and it's a horrible result for England as he sprays a wide and therefore has to bowl again
Shahzad to Johnson, 3 runs Johnson backs away and gets a big inside edge that runs away to fine leg for three runs
Anderson to Johnson, no run Johnson backs away again and just gets a bit of bat through to Prior along the ground, Prior's underarm hits the stumps but Johnson wasn't trying for a run
Anderson to Johnson, OUT Anderson strikes! Good bowling as he aims at the stumps - leg stump to be specific - and Johnson goes for the big hoick through the leg side and he's bowled
Anderson to Hastings, no run good bounce from Anderson, and Hastings defends a ball at chest height
Anderson to Hastings, no run another good bouncer! Hastings looks to guide it to third man and then pulls out, well directed by Anderson
Anderson to Hastings, 1 run Hastings gets off the mark with a clip through midwicket
Anderson to Smith, 1 run Smith pushes hard to point and can only get a single
Woakes to Smith, 1 run another one is driven wide of cover by Smith, who is happy to get a few singles to start with and get his eye in
Woakes to Clarke, 2 runs Clarke goes over the top now, he's pulled deliberately high over midwicket and it just chips safely wide of the man in the deep, a couple of runs for the captain
Woakes to Clarke, 1 run drives one through cover now
Woakes to Smith, 1 run Woakes swings this one down leg and Smith clips it uppishly down to fine leg

Woakes to Clarke, OUT oh, that's a disappointing end for Clarke after he built such a good platform. He has walked at Woakes and tried to pull over midwicket, but this skies off a top edge and doesn't travel very far, Strauss runs in from cover to take a very simple
Woakes to Smith, no run cut away to point and Smith can't beat Collingwood
Anderson to Johnson, no run Johnson leaves his first ball outside off
Anderson to Johnson, no run a touch slower at 131kph and Johnson drives, checking his shot just enough to avoid pushing a caught and bowled back
Anderson to Johnson, no run even slower now at 126kph, and Johnson defends this one
Anderson to Johnson, no run beaten outside off! Anderson gets some really good angle across just outside off and Johnson doesn't get the bat anywhere near it
Anderson to Johnson, no run defended - could this be a maiden?
Anderson to Johnson, no run driven to mid-off, and indeed that was a very valuable maiden over from Anderson
Finn to Smith, FOUR runs super shot! What a cracking drive through cover as he backs off a touch and thumps a pretty good ball that was full and straight, finding the gap at extra cover
Finn to Smith, no run Finn goes the slower bouncer now and Smith swipes, but can't connect
Finn to Smith, 1 run another slower ball and Smith advances, then nudges a single to cover
Finn to Hastings, FOUR runs oh, well done by Hastings as he backs away and is followed by Finn, but Hastings then swivels a pull and helps it fine enough to beat fine leg - more valuable runs
Finn to Hastings, FOUR runs another boundary as Hastings swings and throws everything at this one, getting it high over mid-off and gets enough on it to bounce over the boundary
Finn to Hastings, 1 run another slower ball and Hastings pulls hard through midwicket to the man in the deep
Anderson to Hastings, 1 run Anderson uses the slower ball now and Hastings swings hard, crashing a single down to long-on
Anderson to Smith, 1 run punched away through the off side
Anderson to Hastings, no run slower full toss now and Hastings can't get it away
Anderson to Hastings, 1 run good yorker length ball and all Hastings can do is chip a single to long-on
Anderson to Smith, 1 bye that's an interesting one from Smith! He's tried the reverse hook to Anderson! Didn't get anything on it, but Prior has fumbled and they pick up a bye
Anderson to Hastings, 1 run Hastings swings hard and gets it out through midwicket
Woakes to Hastings, OUT Woakes gets five wickets! Hastings has lifted a slower ball over midwicket but straight to Collingwood in the deep, where he takes a pretty simple catch
Woakes to Smith, 1 run another slower delivery and Smith throws the kitchen sink at this, slapping a single down to long-off
Woakes to Lee, OUT Woakes has six! And the 50th over may not be required after all. Lee has cut hard but in the air and third man takes the catch, it's the substitute fielder Luke Wright down there
Woakes to Smith, (no ball) SIX runs oh, well played Steven Smith! Another slower ball from Woakes, and Smith has waited on it, driving inside out over cover and clearing the boundary, great stroke
Woakes to Smith, 1 run driven away to point
Woakes to Bollinger, no run bouncer from Woakes, and Dougie ducks under it
Woakes to Bollinger, 1 run good yorker gives Woakes a chance, but Bollinger keeps it out and picks up a single
Trott to Bollinger, FOUR runs Bollinger begins with a boundary! He's cut hard and thereare men up in the circle at backward point and fly slip - this pierces the gap
Trott to Bollinger, 1 run crunched out to deep cover for one run, to give Smith the strike

Trott to Smith, 1 run, OUT Smith swings hard, pulls it to deep midwicket and they come back for two runs, Dougie's dive at the non-striker's end is in vain - he's short as Trott takes the throw and breaks the stumps. Australia are all out for 249.
Quite right, Ian. Those are the best figures for England.

It was a funny sort of innings, Watson and Haddin looked like setting a good platform, as did Hussey and Clarke later on. But batsmen kept getting out after making starts. It should be a very interesting chase. Join us for the England innings in half an hour.

So, England will have to score 250 for victory here. Fantastic bowling from Chris Woakes who has finished with 6 for 45 - the second-best figures ever in ODIs for England. Not bad for a bloke in his second one-day international!

Welcome back everyone, I'm Liam Brickhill and I'll be your commentator for the beginning of the second innings. The latest news is that Shaun Marsh has injured his hamstring and won't field. Brett Lee is pawing the turf at the end of his run - he'l take the new ball. Two s
Lee to Strauss, 1 wide pacy start, but wildly inaccurate from Lee. Hurled well wide of off stump, and one of those slips was almost in action to stop that - before Haddin moved across
Lee to Strauss, no run that's better! Strauss whips his bat inside the line as Lee hits a good length on off stump. A leave, rather than a miss, but the line was great
Lee to Strauss, no run and again. Back of a length, hitting the seam and going away from the bat. Strauss watches it carefully and keeps the bat inside the line

Lee to Strauss, no run this time he is beaten! Lee goes fuller outside off, Strauss steps half forward into the drive but is beaten on the outside edge. Lee wanders down to offer him a few tips on his technique
Lee to Strauss, no run a hint of movement back into the left-hander, and good pace from the bowler too. Defended back down the track
Lee to Strauss, no run feisty stuff! Banged in short by Lee, Strauss whips his head out of the way in a hurry. He dealt with a good bouncer pretty well
Lee to Strauss, no run great finish to the over, curving gently in through the air but the pace is anything but gentle. Defended by Strauss
Bollinger to Prior, 2 leg byes off the thigh pad and down to fine leg. That's good running, as they sprint back for the second

Bollinger to Prior, no run pace and bounce, and Prior didn't know much about that! He turns his head away and thrusts the bat out in hope ... but the bouncer ricochets off the glove and grille. That's got the crowd going
Bollinger to Prior, no run it's been a spirited start by Australia's new-ball bowlers, and this time Bollinger hits a length and the ball bursts past the outside edge

Bollinger to Prior, FOUR runs unorthodox, but effective! Back of a length and Prior initially set himself to pull over midwicket. The ball hit the seam and moved towards the slips, but he went through with the shot and ended up lifting it straight back over the bowle
Bollinger to Prior, no run and he follows that up with some back-foot defence
Bollinger to Prior, FOUR runs slashed, and that flies over gully and down to third man for four! Prior is really flinging his bat into these shots, that was a thick edge but it raced away
Lee to Strauss, no run back of a length, with a hint of width. Strauss steps back and cracks into the off side, but straight to the cover fielder

Lee to Strauss, 1 run now the England captain is slashing up and over down to third man! Both batsmen keen to impose themselves early on, but this didn't bounce too far away from the fielder, Bollinger
Lee to Prior, no run this one leaps off a length and hits the splice as Prior hops back in defence
Lee to Prior, no run fuller this time, Prior is sat on the back foot though and drives to cover. Lee's fastest ball of the innings so far
Lee to Prior, no run and he follows it up with a much slower delivery! Spotted early by Prior, who drives to mid-on
Lee to Prior, 1 run tucked into the leg side, and they take the chance for a sprinted single
Bollinger to Prior, 1 run Prior clears the left leg and slaps down the ground ... that won't reach the boundary, however, as deep mid-off swoops to cut it off
Bollinger to Strauss, no run wobbling around on a length, just outside off. Strauss punches into the covers, but hits the field

Bollinger to Strauss, no run that's definitely hit the seam, jagging back in, and Strauss is caught in an awkward position as he sets himself for some sort of paddle-pull. The ball strikes him in the midriff and rolls into the off side
Bollinger to Strauss, 1 run width outside off, Strauss chops down to third man

Bollinger to Prior, FOUR runs crack! All that effort from Bollinger as he charges to the crease, only to see the ball ping out of the middle of the bat and fly to the boundary in a moment. Authoritative pull from Prior, he's ticking nicely now
Bollinger to Prior, no run back of a length again, this time he opts to defend back down the track

Lee to Strauss, no run at the other end, Strauss's absorbing battle with Lee continues! The batsman backed away to leg but Lee followed him with a sharp bouncer that had him ducking for safety, and a verbal barrage to boot!
Lee to Strauss, no run tapped into the off side
Lee to Strauss, no run again Strauss targets the off side, but he can't find the gap as short cover point fields the ball on the bounce
Lee to Strauss, 1 run so instead, he tucks into the wide spaces on the leg side, picking up a single
Lee to Prior, no run close to the edge! That actually sounded like he may have got something on it, plenty of daylight between bat and ball however

Lee to Prior, OUT bowled 'im! Lee has comprehensively won this battle, firing one at the top of off. Prior's feet went nowhere, the ball bursts past his attempted nurdle to gully and makes a mess of the stumps. Lee celebrates with a hop and a kick, and that's the fir

Bollinger to Strauss, OUT two wickets in two balls! Both openers depart, England are in a hole now. Short, Strauss was quickly onto the pull but the ball didn't come off the middle of the bat, flying straight to Smith at square leg for an easy catch
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run slower ball, a cutter, and it's pulled down quite short. Pietersen defends
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run thick inside edge, that could so easily have gone back to hit the stumps! Luckily for Pietersen, it hits the body and bounces harmlessly towards the slips
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run hurled down on a length, outside off, and left alone
Bollinger to Pietersen, 2 runs fuller, the batsman leans forward into a cautious drive and is off the mark with a scurried two
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run and another good leave to end the over

Lee to Trott, OUT gone first ball! Lee strikes again! It wasn't the best ball, a touch short and angling down the leg side. Trott flicked off his hip but in the air, and Bollinger tumbles forward at short fine leg to take the catch. England are in disarray. Brett Lee
Lee to Bell, (no ball) no, short and ballooning over the ducking batsman. And what's more, he's over-stepped - it's a no-ball and his next delivery will be a Free Hit

Lee to Bell, 1 run short again, Bell flails and pops it straight up in the air. The crowd roar as Smith takes the catch, they perhaps don't quite realise what's going on ... Lee's got a smile on his face
Lee to Pietersen, 2 runs a thick outside edge bounces down to third man ... and the return from the fielder is atrocious, yorking Haddin and they come back for another
Lee to Pietersen, no run tapped into the covers
Lee to Pietersen, 1 run full, straight and fast. Pushed just wide of mid-on and they dash through for one
Lee to Bell, no run languid drive from Bell, a good-looking shot but it goes straight to the fielder
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run on a length and defended by Pietersen ... who spots the opportunity for a quick single as mid-off is slow to amble in to field. Hands on hips from Bollinger
Bollinger to Bell, no run left alone outside off stump
Bollinger to Bell, no run Bell smelt that one, a bouncer bursting past his helmet and into Haddin's gloves. The 'keeper appeals, who knows why
Bollinger to Bell, no run pushed to cover point
Bollinger to Bell, 2 runs short and Bell is on the pull, that hits the splice and loops up slowly ... but it's got enough on it to evade the fielder running back from square leg
Bollinger to Bell, no run going across the right-hander on the angle, going further off the seam, and Bell leaves alone
Johnson to Pietersen, no run decent start, just short of a good length but aimed right at off stump. Pietersen gets across and defends to leg
Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs slapped straight back down the ground, the ball scorches across the turf and over the boundary. Strong shot!

Johnson to Pietersen, no run that'll have stung the hands of Hussey at short extra cover! Full and wide, absolutely slammed out the middle but straight at the fielder. He can see the funny side. Great effort to even stop that actually
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run full and straight, Pietersen pushes firmly back to the bowler, who parries to his right to give away a single
Johnson to Bell, 1 run tucked off the pads into the leg side
Johnson to Pietersen, 2 runs Pietersen steps right across to the off side and clips a leg-stump delivery out into the deep ... Fine leg is up but deep square sprints across to keep them to two
Bollinger to Bell, 1 run squirted into the off side, Hussey is still close in in that catching position at cover, he dives to his left and gets a hand to it but can't quite stop the single
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run offcutter from Bollinger, slower and stopping in the wicket. Pietersen pushes into the leg side
Bollinger to Pietersen, FOUR runs Pietersen is counter-attacking in fine style here, lunging forward to smash this through the covers. There's no stopping that
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run extravagant leave to follow that up, KP struts down to tap the wicket
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run tapped to deep mid-off for one

Bollinger to Bell, 1 run flashed airily through gully! That would've resulted in a regulation catch in a Test match, but here it's a single down to third man. Keeps the bowler interested though, and that's the end of the first Powerplay
Johnson to Bell, 1 run glanced behind square on the leg side

Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs the first really testing delivery Johnson has bowled today, and it goes for four! Pietersen was caught on the crease, the ball leaving him off the pitch and taking a thick edge. That beats slip, but goes fine enough to beat third man
Johnson to Pietersen, no run defended watchfully into the off side

Johnson to Pietersen, no run direct hit would've been interesting here! Pietersen dropped it into the off side and both batsmen left their creases ... but Smith swoops in a flash and fires a shy at the non-striker's end. Bell dives, and the throw goes wide. He'd hav
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run tapped to deep mid-off, and a single is taken
Johnson to Bell, no run defended down to gully off the back foot
Hastings to Pietersen, 1 run good start from him, this ball has just started to stick in the surface and do a little, and yet another edge flies off the bat and down to third man
Hastings to Bell, no run coming in through the air and off the seam, Bell defends with bat and pad right together
Hastings to Bell, no run aggression from Bell, charging down the track but his drive can't pierce the off side field
Hastings to Bell, no run tapped down towards cover, no single to be had
Hastings to Bell, 1 run now he does find space, running one down to third man for an easy single
Hastings to Pietersen, 1 run Pietersen walks down and across his stumps, and aims a controlled paddle-pull to midwicket
Johnson to Pietersen, no run just past the edge! Great line from Johnson, Pietersen had to play at that. Slip, who had been moved, is back in place
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run nudged into the leg side for one
Johnson to Bell, 1 run chopped down to third man
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run a bit of bat, a bit of pad, and as the ball rolls to midwicket - with Johnson in hot pursuit - they scamper through for one

Johnson to Bell, (no ball) everything was right about this ball, tucking Bell up nicely in defence, except for the fact that he's been called for a no-ball. That's a bit harsh, he was certainly tight on the line but it was a borderline call. Free Hit coming up
Johnson to Bell, FOUR runs back of a length, Bell makes room and flaps over mid-off. White sprints after it but can't pull it back in time
Johnson to Bell, no run and defence to finish the over
Hastings to Pietersen, 1 wide Pietersen charges down the wicket but Hastings spots him coming and responds with a canny slower-ball bouncer ... that's a bit too short though, and it's called wide
Hastings to Pietersen, 1 run pushed into the gap between mid-off and cover, quick single
Hastings to Bell, no run Bell is dancing down the track now, but can't get to the pitch
Hastings to Bell, 1 run nicely driven by Bell, stretching well forward, but there's a sweeper out on the cover boundary
Hastings to Pietersen, no run full, pushed to point
Hastings to Pietersen, FOUR runs great shot, intelligent batting. Back of a length and Pietersen picks up four with the latest of late cuts, a deft little shot that beats third man
Hastings to Pietersen, no run straighter from Hastings, Pietersen taps to point
Johnson to Bell, no run Bell hops down the track and sends the ball back to the bowler ... KP had backed up quite far and Johnson was on the ball in a flash, he's safely back to his crease though
Johnson to Bell, no run tapped down, straight to the man at gully on the bounce
Johnson to Bell, no run this time it's Smith at point doing the fielding, diving to his left to stop Bell's shot. Good effort from him
Johnson to Bell, no run nicely straight from Johnson, Bell stays deep in the crease and defends
Johnson to Bell, 1 run short and pacy from Johnson, Bell is hurried as he tries to pull ... the ball hits something though, the bat handle or the glove, and they take a single
Johnson to Pietersen, no run inside edge ... the ball rolls back close to the stumps but Pietersen shows good awareness to quickly flick it away and avert the danger
Hastings to Bell, no run Bell advances and then defends
Hastings to Bell, no run Bell defends back down towards Hastings
Hastings to Bell, 1 run short ball now and Bell turns a hook around the corner to Bollinger at fine leg
Hastings to Pietersen, no run Hastings goes for the bouncer now and Pietersen ducks underneath it
Hastings to Pietersen, 1 run quick single now as KP walks across and nudges it wide of point
Hastings to Bell, 2 runs driven uppishly, shouts of catch it as it sails through cover but it is safe and Bell picks up two runs to the man in the deep
Smith to Pietersen, 1 run some turn away from Pietersen, who punches through cover gently for a run
Smith to Bell, 2 runs Bell advances and lofts this high but safely over cover and it lobs into the outfield
Smith to Bell, 1 run cut hard through cover to the man in the deep
Smith to Pietersen, no run a big stride forward from Pietersen as Smith drags the length back, the batsman defends
Smith to Pietersen, no run tossed up on middle stump, Pietersen clips to Hussey at short midwicket

Smith to Pietersen, no run tossed up and Pietersen drives back to Smith, who dives and nearly makes a catch, but there's no reaction from anyone. Hold on, though, Smith is saying he's not sure if he's taken it. He's come up with the ball clutched to his body. Asad R
Hastings to Bell, 1 run clipped away through square leg
Hastings to Pietersen, 1 run tip and run from Pietersen as he nudges to cover
Hastings to Bell, no run pushed back down the pitch
Hastings to Bell, 1 run a good punchy drive through cover from Bell, who picks up a single to the man in the deep
Hastings to Pietersen, no run Pietersen advances down the pitch again, and then clips defensively to leg
Hastings to Pietersen, no run slower ball now and Pietersen drives on the bounce to Clarke at short cover
Smith to Bell, 1 run Bell advances to Smith and drives edgily and uppishly over cover point, it bounces safely short of the fielder
Smith to Pietersen, no run solidly defended back to the bowler
Smith to Pietersen, 1 run quicker and flatter, and it's punched through cover
Smith to Bell, 2 runs well played by Bell as he takes this one off middle stump and dabs a paddle sweep fine enough to get two runs
Smith to Bell, no run tossed up on leg stump, it's clipped to midwicket
Smith to Bell, 1 run on the pads and it's tickled around the corner to short fine leg
Hastings to Bell, 1 run cut hard forward of point and another easy single
Hastings to Pietersen, 1 run slower short ball now and Pietersen pulls over midwicket
Hastings to Bell, no run walks down the pitch and dabs outside off but Hastings goes wide enough to beat the bat
Hastings to Bell, 1 run fullish and straight, Bell drives a bump ball down to mid-off, where the fielder dives across but can't stop it
Hastings to Pietersen, no run pushed to mid-off again and this time Clarke does get across to cut it off
Hastings to Pietersen, no run goes for the pull now and he can't connect
Smith to Bell, no run Bell dances down the pitch and drives to cover
Smith to Bell, 1 run a little shorter now and Bell cuts to deep point
Smith to Pietersen, no run Pietersen now uses his feet to Smith, but then checks his shot
Smith to Pietersen, 1 run and now Pietersen turns this into a full toss and swipes it across wide of midwicket
Smith to Bell, 1 run drifting in to the pads, and soft hands from KP as he nudges it to leg
Smith to Pietersen, no run good bowling, Pietersen advances and Smith sends it in flatter and quicker, the batsman has to check his shot again
Hastings to Bell, no run lovely fielding by David Hussey at gully, as he launches himself to his right to save a good late cut from Bell that might have run away to the boundary
Hastings to Bell, 1 run slower ball now, which is chipped through square leg and they can't justify a second run
Hastings to Pietersen, 2 runs driven hard through cover for another easy run

Hastings to Pietersen, OUT Pietersen is gone! Oh, John Hastings has done it with the slower bouncer! It has absolutely stopped in mid-air on the way to Pietersen, who wants to pull hard but is playing too quickly and ends up swinging one-handed and gets a top edge t
Hastings to Morgan, no run on the pads and Morgan can't get it away
Hastings to Morgan, 1 run good yorker now but Morgan manages to drive it wide of cover to get off the mark
Smith to Morgan, 1 run tossed up well outside off and Morgan steps across to work it through the leg side
Smith to Bell, no run good flight from Smith, and Bell uses the feet and then drives to mid-on
Smith to Bell, no run cut away to point and can't find the gap
Smith to Bell, 1 run driven to long-off for a comfortable single

Smith to Morgan, OUT another one goes! Morgan has holed out to Smith! Not a very clever piece of batting, you'd have to say, as he gets underneath a lofted drive and skies it to long-off, where Johnson runs around to his right and takes a catch that nearly bobbles o
Smith to Bell, no run Bell reaches at this one and pushes to point
Hastings to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood is beaten outside off first ball, there's no foot movement there as he just tries to dab a cut away
Hastings to PD Collingwood, no run this time Collingwood gets across to defend with a straight bat
Hastings to PD Collingwood, 1 run soft hands from Collingwood as he nudges to leg and gets off the mark
Hastings to Bell, no run walks across this time and clips it to leg
Hastings to Bell, 1 run bouncer from Hastings and Bell pulls, just getting over the top of it to get a run to square leg
Hastings to PD Collingwood, no run another bouncer wide of off, Collingwood barely even moves as he leaves this one alone
Smith to Bell, 1 run Smith tosses this one up on off stump and Bell drives down to long-off
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood leans forward and defends
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run fuller ball and Collingwood clips to mid-on
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run on the back foot now, Collingwood crunches a cut through cover point
Smith to Bell, 1 run a bit of a long hop here but it's not put away as Bell pulls a single down towards long-on
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood defends solidly
Hastings to Bell, no run Bell tries to dab a cut away fine but this one beats the bat
Hastings to Bell, no run driven hard but straight to mid-off
Hastings to Bell, no run slower ball - and much slower at 104kph - and it's driven to mid-on

Hastings to Bell, OUT gone! Bell has played on and Hastings has got rid of both the well-set batsmen in KP and Bell. This one swings in and Bell tries for the late cut, the movement does him in and his bottom edge runs on to the off stump
Hastings to Woakes, 1 run Woakes gets off the mark straight away with a thickish edge to third man
Hastings to PD Collingwood, 1 run fullish and angling in to Collingwood, who gets a single as his drive is knocked down at short cover
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run a tad short from Smith and Woakes punches it wide of mid-off
Smith to Woakes, no run tries for the pull but can't get it away
Smith to Woakes, no run well flighted and Woakes drives to cover
Smith to Woakes, 1 run another one is driven through the off side, this time through the gap at cover
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run really tossed up to tempt the batsman, Smith dives across to save the off-drive off his own bowling
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run punched through extra cover for a single
Hastings to PD Collingwood, no run Hastings angles this in and attacks the stumps, it's driven to mid-on
Hastings to PD Collingwood, no run driven towards mid-off this time and can't find the gap
Hastings to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs a good shot now from Collingwood, he's just forced this flick wide of mid-on, just placed well enough to find the gap and it runs away for a boundary
Hastings to PD Collingwood, 2 runs soft hands now as Collingwood clips through midwicket and races back for two runs
Hastings to PD Collingwood, no run bouncer, and this one looked too high but the umpires have been very lenient today on such decisions and again a wide is not called
Hastings to PD Collingwood, 1 wide but this one is called a wide as Collingwood walks across outside off and Hastings sends it much wider
Hastings to PD Collingwood, no run beaten outside off, just a good length delivery that angles in and Collingwood played the wrong line
Smith to Woakes, no run pushed back to the bowler who does his own fielding
Smith to Woakes, no run cut to backward point where White does the fielding
Smith to Woakes, 1 run slower and shorter, Woakes waits on it and turns a single through square leg
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run driven down towards long-on, just another gentle single
Smith to Woakes, 1 run pushed down to long-off now and another single
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run oooh, a touch edgy here as Collingwood leans forward and gets it off the shoulder of the bat, the ball lobs up but well short of Smith
Johnson to Woakes, 1 run banged in on the hips and it's clipped uppishly to square leg
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 1 run again it's soft hands from Collingwood, who nudges a single to midwicket
Johnson to Woakes, no run angled across Woakes, who cuts to backward point
Johnson to Woakes, no run bouncer now from Johnson, and it's ducked by Woakes
Johnson to Woakes, 1 run driven away through cover for another single
Johnson to PD Collingwood, 1 run clipped away through square leg
Smith to PD Collingwood, 2 runs flicked through leg for some more runs
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run driven back past the bowler
Smith to Woakes, 1 run pushed down to long-off, where Bollinger does the fielding
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run punched wide of cover this time
Smith to Woakes, 1 run well flighted by Smith and Woakes goes for the dab sweep around the corner
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run pushed straight to Clarke at cover
Johnson to Woakes, no run pushed right across Woakes, who tries for the square drive but can't connect
Johnson to Woakes, no run beaten outside off this time
Johnson to Woakes, no run opens the face and tries to run a single through point but just finds the fielder
Johnson to Woakes, no run again the angle across Woakes is difficult for the batsman, who tries to drive and is beaten
Johnson to Woakes, no run pushed to point and can't find a run
Johnson to Woakes, no run and that's a maiden, as Woakes defends the last ball

Watson to PD Collingwood, OUT and Watson strikes with his first ball! Collingwood decided he was going after the medium-pacer and lofted it high over mid-on, Hastings began in the circle and ran halfway back to the boundary to take an outstanding catch running with
Watson to Woakes, no run pushed away defensively to the off side

Watson to Woakes, no run tickled down leg side and is that a dropped chance? Haddin diving to his left has missed the take with his left hand, but it's hard to see what that has come off - perhaps off the trousers. Not bat.
Watson to Woakes, no run pushed away defensively
Watson to Woakes, no run tries to force this through leg but can't connect
Johnson to Shahzad, no run sharp bouncer greets Shahzad! He wears it on the chest, and there are plenty of words being flung around too
Johnson to Shahzad, 1 wide not the greatest follow-up, much too wide outside off stump
Johnson to Shahzad, no run Johnson re-adjusts his line, a nervous waft from the batsman
Johnson to Shahzad, no run Shahzad is forward and driving without any great conviction, and he's easily beaten on the outside edge
Johnson to Shahzad, no run Johnson is firing it past the edge at will when he gets it right, as he does now. Shahzad's feet go nowhere as he stands at the crease to defend
Johnson to Shahzad, no run the bowler attacks the stumps, this time the bat comes down in time to keep the ball out
Johnson to Shahzad, no run pushed full again but slightly wider of off, yet again the ball flies past the edge of the bat
Watson to Anderson, no run short on off stump, Anderson sways out of the way
Watson to Anderson, (no ball) another bouncer from Watson, this is much too short and balloons over the batsman
Watson to Anderson, no run back of a length, outside off and oast the edge
Watson to Anderson, no run another nervous swish from Anderson, not sure how much longer England's tail can survive these conditions
Watson to Anderson, FOUR runs edged! Off the shoulder of the bat though, and the ball loops over a leaping second slip
Watson to Anderson, no run booming cover drive this time ... but he hits nothing but fresh air

Watson to Anderson, no run short on off stump to end the over, Anderson tries to uppercut it but again can't get a touch on it. Watto wanders down and stares in disbelief. Could easily have a had a third wicket any number of times in this over
Johnson to Shahzad, no run on a length, but outside off and Shahzad leaves alone
Johnson to Shahzad, no run dug in shorter and much faster by Johnson, the ball rises on Shahzad but he rides the bounce and plays it down to gully
Johnson to Shahzad, no run bouncer from Johnson! He's got Shahzad hopping nervously, and the umpire calls one for the over with a wide smile on his face
Johnson to Shahzad, no run this one hits the seam and jags away, past the edge for the umpteenth time

Johnson to Shahzad, 1 run aimed at the top of middle, nudged to short third man and there's utter confusion between the three Englishmen out there - Shahzad has a runner remember - which really should've resulted in a run-out. The throw is wide, however
Johnson to Anderson, no run just short of a length, tapped down to point
Watson to Shahzad, no run appeal as a good bouncer hits something on the way throught to Haddin ... was that off the shoulder? Not off the bat, reckons Umpire Rauf, and calls one for the over
Watson to Shahzad, 1 run nudged off the hip, and an easy single into the leg side
Watson to Anderson, 1 run and Anderson rotates the strike straight away with another quick single
Watson to Shahzad, (no ball) great line and length from Watson, again he's past the edge, but he's over-stepped so the next ball is going to be a Free Hit
Watson to Shahzad, SIX runs Shahzad takes full toll, swinging mightily to send a length ball sailing over wide long-on! 84 metre boundary there
Watson to Shahzad, no run and he follows that up with studied defence
Watson to Shahzad, 1 run full on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
Bollinger to Shahzad, no run Shahzad continues to cling limpet-like to the crease, defending this
Bollinger to Shahzad, no run banged into the pitch, the ball rises past the edge of the bat
Bollinger to Shahzad, no run tapped down defensively to gully, nothing in the batsman's half

Bollinger to Shahzad, no run there's spite and malice in this bouncer! Shahzad was in no position to play it, throwing the hands out. The ball takes the splice of the bat and lobs up, falling just past the stumps
Bollinger to Shahzad, no run yet again past the edge. Surely, eventually, he'll get a touch on one of these?
Watson to Anderson, no run short on off stump, Anderson gives himself room and flashes wildly, play-and-a-miss
Watson to Anderson, no run on a length, guided down to that man at deep gully/short third man
Watson to Anderson, no run dug in short, past Anderson's grille as he plays a classic tailender's waft
Watson to Anderson, no run fuller, wider, and driven off the toe of the bat to cover
Watson to Anderson, FOUR runs that one's come out of the middle! Smeared over mid-on by Anderson, one bounce and over the rope
Watson to Anderson, no run well, he was aiming to send this one into the stratosphere, just shutting his eyes and heaving wildly to leg. Nowhere near it
Bollinger to Finn, no run full on off stump, Finn taps to mid-on
Bollinger to Finn, no run England's No. 11 is ducking now as Bollinger sends down a bouncer. One for the over, says the umpire
Bollinger to Finn, 3 runs not the worst shot by Finn, backing away and cracking a length delivery up and over cover. Not enough on it to reach the boundary, however
Bollinger to Anderson, FOUR runs slap! Anderson is starting to middle a couple now. He comes charging down the wicket and smashes this through extra cover
Bollinger to Anderson, 1 run slower ball from Bollinger, not picked at all by Anderson who is through with the shot before the ball gets to him, but they pick up one into the leg side all the same

Bollinger to Finn, FOUR runs England's tailenders are enjoying themselves now! Just short of a good length, Finn just opens his stance and swings this straight down the ground, standing to admire the shot as the ball sails away
Lee to Anderson, no run Anderson immediately backs away and tries to cut, past the edge
Lee to Anderson, 1 run tapped down just to gully's right, they hurry through for one

Lee to Finn, no run short, and Finn is left lying on the ground in ungainly fashion as he gets out of the way of that. Slower-ball bouncer. Finn obviously likes the feel of the wicket against his derriere, he falls over enough when he's bowling
Lee to Finn, no run short again, dealt with much more effectively this time
Lee to Finn, no run fired full and straight, but Finn's bat comes down in good time
Lee to Finn, 1 run on a length around off stump, Finn gives himself some room and cracks it towards mid-off. Clarke does well to cut the shot off
Bollinger to Finn, no run just short of a good length, Finn positions himself for an ambitious pull but the ball flies between bat and body and through to the keeper
Bollinger to Finn, 1 run full and straight, swiped across the line into the leg side
Bollinger to Anderson, 1 run Bollinger aims for the yorker, gets it slightly wrong and Anderson gets bat on the full toss to pick up another single
Bollinger to Finn, FOUR runs heaved into the leg side, that's found the gap and Finn collects another boundary!
Bollinger to Finn, no run now he's charging down the track and slogging wildly, Bollinger pushes it slightly wider of off and Finn gets nowhere near it

Bollinger to Finn, FOUR runs straight back over the bowler's head, baseball style! Well, England may not have any chance of winning this, but the batsman are having fun. Making a bit of dosh for charity too, which is good
Lee to Anderson, 1 run slashed down to third man for one
Lee to Finn, no run big swing, big miss
Lee to Finn, no run Finn is knocked off his feet by a searing yorker! Somehow he's found a way to keep that out...
Lee to Finn, no run full and fast again, Finn makes room and taps gently to cover
Lee to Finn, no run slower-ball bouncer from Lee, an almighty heave from Finn but he doesn't get near it
Lee to Finn, FOUR runs another slower ball, this time he spots it and clobbers it over midwicket!
Bollinger to Anderson, (no ball) ooh, that's nasty. That's slipped out as a very high full toss - a beamer really - at about sternum height. The ball evades Haddin too
Bollinger to Anderson, no run that's more like it. On a length and aimed at the stumps, tapped to gully

Bollinger to Anderson, no run Anderson gives himself acres of room as Bollinger fires in a yorker outside off, in fact Anderson has given himself so much room that he almost tumbles over towards square leg. Nowhere near hitting it
Bollinger to Anderson, 1 run tapped straight to Hussey at cover, they set off for a suicidal single and the throw is wide
Bollinger to Finn, FOUR runs another boundary for Finn! He picks up the length early and swings this away to wide midwicket
Bollinger to Finn, 1 run much fuller, slapped to long-on for one
Bollinger to Anderson, no run Anderson backs away, trying to open up the off side, but completely misses a length delivery from Bollinger

Lee to Finn, 3 runs well Finn has got an excellent connection on this one too! Full and straight from Lee, the batsman cracks it in the air to wide long-on and only a great piece of fielding from Hastings saves the boundary
Lee to Anderson, no run yorker, outside off, and it slips right under Anderson's bat
Lee to Anderson, no run back of a length, Anderson tries to run it down to third man but ball beats bat
Lee to Anderson, 2 runs Anderson backs right away to leg and slashes a square drive out into the deep. They run hard and are easily back for the second when the throw arrives at the stumps
Lee to Anderson, no run full and straight, Anderson defends awkwardly to cover
Lee to Anderson, no run on a length, angling across the left-hander and he pulls his bat inside the line to leave
Watson to Finn, SIX runs into the stands! What a shot from Finn, gunbarrel straight, a monstrous hit and there's the fifty partnership. Highest 10th wicket partnership by England in an ODI
Watson to Finn, no run just past the off stump! Finn looked like a batsman hitting that six, now he's a tailender as he closes his eyes and swings wildly to leg

That's all from your commentary team, George Binoy, Brydon Coverdale and Liam Brickhill. Join us again for the 6th match of the series at Sydney on Wednesday (14:20 local, 03:20 GMT). Until then, goodbye!

"The reason we haven't got it right, I'm not sure, but hopefully we can use the last two games to fix our problems. Morgs [Eoin Morgan] has struggled, but you can't put it on his shoulders. Apart from Trott none of the batsmen have been great. We've played very badly, we c
Read all about today's action in Andrew McGlashan's bulletin, and do stick with us to read some quotes from the presentation ceremony.

So, some consolation for Australia after the Ashes with a one-day series win secured with two games to spare. It was a team effort from them with both bat and ball today, Michael Clarke finding some semblance of form with his half-century. It looked like England would push
Australia won by 51 runs
Player of the match is Chris Woakes, ENG
